Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Gordion cup; interior: in tondo, part of incised palmette, with added red heart and alternate petals, and volute within border of, from centre, two rows of staggered dots separated by dilute line between triple narrow bands; alternate black and red tongues with faded white dots between; exterior glazed black.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.237, 1888,0601.324, 1888,0601.426 and 1948,0815.3 The pieces are gathered in Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., pl. 26.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 381, no. B534)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 153, note 82)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 321, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0413) (Phase 1)
